revised_title: Characterization of Persistent Sodium Currents in Rat Ventricular Myocytes
tldr: The authors discovered that rat ventricular myocytes have persistent sodium currents that are more resistant to inactivation and activate at more negative membrane potentials compared to transient sodium currents. These persistent sodium currents contribute to the plateau phase of cardiac action potentials and are more sensitive to block by TTX and anti-arrhythmic agents like lidocaine and quinidine. The study provides insights into the underlying mechanisms of cardiac electrical activity and potential therapeutic targets for arrhythmia treatment.
